go	go (from/ to) fika, fikia the river goes to the ocean mto huu hufika baharini the differences between the friends goes back a long way kutoelewana kwa hawa marafiki wawili ni kwa muda mrefu. go a long way (last) dumu he makes his wages go a long way hutumia mshahara wake kwa uangalifu; (endure) (colloq) -wa kiasi cha kuvumilika. go a long way/far towards doing sth changia, saidia. go (very) far dumu; (a person, future tense) fanikiwa. go too far vuka mpaka, zidi you've gone too far! umezidi. go (any) further pita/kiwango fulani I've gone as far as I can in this job I can't go any furthernimefikia kikomo changu katika kazi hii. go as/so far as to do sth thubutu. as far as it goes kwa kiasi fulani. His views are valid as far as they go hoja zake ni za msingi kwa kiasi fulani. go to great lengths/ trouble (to do sth) jitahidi/hangaika sana; -wa mwangalifu kufanya jambo vizuri. go as low/high as (a price) shuka/panda hadi, fikia kiwango fulani. go one better (than sby) fanya vizuri zaidi (kuliko mtu mwingine).

go	(idiomatic uses) go abouttembea, randaranda; (rumors, stories) enea; (a ship) badili njia. go about sth anza kuifanya kazi. please go about it more carefully tafadhali ifanye kwa uangalifu zaidi. go about one's business jishughulisha na mambo yako. go about with sby fuatana na, -wa na mtu mwingine mara kwa mara. go after/sth jaribu kupata kitu fulani. go against sby pinga do not go against your employer usipingane na mwajiri wako; elekea/tokea vibaya the game is going against them wanaelekea kushindwa. go against sth enda, -wa kinyume na it will not go against my tastes haitakuwa kinyume na vionjo vyangu. go ahead endelea they are go ahead people ni watu wanaopenda maendeleo may I leave? yes go ahead naweza kuondoka? ndiyo bila wasiwasi. go ahead {n} ruhusa ya kuendelea. go along endelea: the lessons will be easy as you go along masomo yatakuwa rahisi kadiri unavyoendelea. go along with sby sindikiza, fuatana na she will goalong with her boy friend atamsindikiza mpenzi wake; (agree) kubaliana na we can't go along with him on that argument hatuwezi kukubaliana na yeye katika hoja ile. go at sby/sth shambulia, vamia they went at it tooth and nail/hammer and tongswalishambuliana vikali; shughulikia kikamilifu. go away ondoka. go away with sby ondoka na, chukua she has gone away with my book ameondoka na kitabu changu. go back rudi; rudi nyuma our friendship goes back to the 1960s when we were at Makerere urafiki wetu ulianza zamani katika miaka ya
go	tulipokuwa Makerere. go back on/upon vunja (km ahadi). go before (sth) tangulia. go behind tafuta. go behind sby's back sengenya, fanyia mtu kitu pasipo yeye kujua. go beyond sth vuka mpaka, zidi you are going beyond your responsibility umevuka mpaka wa madaraka yako that's going beyond a joke imezidi. go bypita he went by in a hurry alipita haraka sana. go by sth fuata, ongozwa na go by the book fuata sheria barabara. go by/under the name tumia jina (fulani), itwa (fulani). go -byn. give sby/sth the go-by(colloq) puuza, dharau. go down (a ship) zama; (the sun, moon) tua; (food and drink) telemka, mezwa the piece of meat won't go down siwezi kuimeza nyama hii; ondoka chuo kikuu (baada ya kuhitimu; (the sea, wind etc) pungua, tulia; (prices) poa, shuka the price of meat has gone downbei ya nyama imeshuka. go down to the coast/ village tembelea pwani/kijijini nk go down before sby shindwa au pinduliwa. go down (in sth) andikwa; kumbukwa you will go down in history as a heroutakumbukwa kuwa shujaa mkuu. go down to be endelea the liberation of man goes down to the present century ukombozi wa binadamu umeendelea hadi karne hii. go down (with sby) (a story) kubaliwa, pendwa (na msikilizaji) the story won't go down with my son mwanangu hatapenda hadithi hii the idea of the second wife does not go down well with the first wife fikra za kuoa mke wa pili hazikubaliwi na mke wa kwanza. go down (with sth) ugua; pata ugonjwa the beggar has gone down with cholera yule ombaomba amepata kipindupindu. go for sby -enda kumchukua (fulani) go for the children enda kuchukua watoto; shambulia the audience went for me in the seminar wasikilizaji walinishambulia katika semina; kinai. go off with sby/sth iba, toweka na (kitu), torosha He has gone off with your sisteramemtorosha dada yako. go on (time) pita As days went on kadiri siku zilivyopita; (behave) endelea na tabia (hasa mbaya) if she goes on like this she will be divorcedakiendelea na tabia hii atatalikiwa; (colloq) ondoka hapa. goings-on {n} pl (colloq) matukio, mambo (agh. ya ajabuajabu). on going {adj} -enye kuendelea. go out toka, ondoka (chumbani, nyumbani nk); toka (kwenda kwenye burudani karamu nk; (fire, light) zimika; (fashion) -wa zilipendwa; (a government) acha madaraka, jiuzulu (kutoka madarakani); (as used by the workers) goma. we shall get better by going out tutapata mishahara mizuri zaidi kwa kugoma; (review) rudia. going over {n} (colloq) kuchunguza; uchunguzi; (slang) piga; (beating) kung'uta they gave him a thorough going -overwalimkung'uta. go over to sby/sth badili kitu kimoja kwa kingine he went over to Rex amebadili sigara aliyokuwa akivuta kwa Rex. go roundtosheleza wote we don't have enough drinks to go round hatuna vinywaji vya kuwatosheleza wote; zunguka. go round (to a place/ to do sth) zuru, tembelea, tembea. go round the bend (colloq) pata wazimu, kasirika, -wa mwehu. go throughpitishwa, idhinishwa the motion did not go through pendekezo halikuidhinishwa. go through sth (discussion) jadili kwa undani; (paper, book etc) pitia; (search) pekua, shiriki; (suffer) teseka, pitia you 'll have to go through the hardshipsutalazimika kuteseka; (a book, edition etc) uzwa; maliza, tumia (fedha). go through with sth timiza, kamilisha, endelea hadi mwisho. go to/towards sth changia, saidia kufanya the savings will go towards the car I want to buy akiba itachangia fedha za kununulia gari nililokusudia. go together enda pamoja, ambatana war and famine go togethervita na njaa huenda pamoja; endana, chukuana the black coat and white shirt go together koti jeusi na shati jeupe vinachukuana. go under zama; fig) shindwa; (business) filisika. go up panda the prices will go up bei zitapanda; (buildings) jengwa; (explosion, fire) lipuliwa, teketezwa; ingia chuo kikuu; -enda mjini (agh. mji mkuu). go up sth panda, kwea mlima, mti, ngazi. go with sby/sth ambatana; fuatana go with him fuatana naye; (views etc) kubaliana; (together) enda pamoja; ambatana the table goes with the dining chairs meza inaambatana na viti vya kulia; (match) chukuana this suit doesn't go with white shoes suti hii haichukuani na viatu vyeupe; (colloq) (a young man and a girl) tembea/fuatana. go without (sth) kosa, vumilia kutokuwa (na kitu fulani) you will have to go without a breakfast utalazimika kuvumilia kukaa pasipo kifungua kinywa go without saying inafahamika pasi kuelezwa, bila kupingwa. going
go	{n} hali ya njia, barabara kwa matembezi nk go while the going is good ondoka wakati hali inaruhusu.
go	kuondoka (usu) (pl) (lit, and fig). comings and goings kuja na kuondoka.
go	mwendo, kasi. {n} (all uses colloq) all systems go mambo tayari (kuondoka). all the go -enyewe, -a kisasa. at one go kwa mpigo mmoja. be full of go; have plenty of go -wa na bidii/juhudi nyingi. be on the go shughulika. have a go (at sth) jaribu. near go ponea chupuchupu. no gomwanzo mbaya; (impossible situation) hali isiyowezekana/mbaya it's no go asking to go to the disco haiwezekani kuomba kwenda disko. no go area eneo lililopigwa marufuku. go between msuluhishi; tarishi; (a marriage) mshenga; (seduction) kuwadi.

(fig) hands off! Acha! Usiguse! hands up! heart	kiini cha hisia, (hususa mapenzi) undani wa tabia ya mtu a man with a kind heartmtu mwenye roho nzuri/huruma. after one's ownheart -enye kupendeza nafsi; -a kuafikiana.at heart kimoyomoyo, kwa kweli; kimsingi. have sth at heart penda moyoni, vutiwa/pendezewa na. from (the bottom of) one's heart kwa yakini, kwa dhati. in one's heart of hearts moyoni. to one's heart's content kiasi chake. with all one's heart kwa utashi/moyo wote I love you with all my heart nakupenda kwa moyo wangu wote. heart and soul kabisa I am yours heart and soul mimi ni wako wa daima break a person's heart vunja moyo; sikitisha. cry one's heart out wazia sana (agh kwa siri). do one's heart good tia moyo. get/learn/know sth by heart kariri. have a heartonyesha huruma. have a change of heartbadilisha mawazo/msimamo. have the heart to(usu neg) -wa na moyo mgumu, -tokuwa na huruma. have one's heart in sth vutiwa/pendezewa na kitu. have one's heart in one's boots katishwa tamaa sana. have one's heart in one's mouth ogopa sana. have one's heart in the right place -wa na moyo mzuri; -wa mkweli. have one's heart set on sth taka sana. lose heart kata tamaa. lose one's heart to sby/sth penda sana mtu/kitu. set one's heart on sth/having sth/doing sth etc taka sana; -wa na shauku kupata/kufanya kitu. take (fresh) heart (at sth) jiamini. take sth to heart athiriwa na jambo. wear one's heart on/upon one's sleeve onyesha hisia kwa uwazi.

Church) Misa kuu. high-minded {adj} -enye msimamo, -enye maadili. high-mindedly {adv} . high-mindedness {n}. high-necked {adj} (a dress) -a kukaba roho. high-pitched {adj} (sounds) -kali, (roof) -a paa -liochongoka. high-powered {adj} -enye juhudi, -enye nguvu nyingi. high-pressure {n} kanieneo ya juu; (fig) shupavu, -enye juhudi. high-priced {adj} ghali. high priest {n} kuhani mkuu. high-principled {adj} -enye msimamo, nyofu. high-ranking {n} {adj} (officers) -enye cheo cha juu. high rise {adj} maghohorofa marefu. highroad {n} barabara kuu, (fig) njia ya moja kwa moja. high school nsekondari ya juu. the high seas {n} bahari kuu. high-sounding {adj} (style) -enye kuvutia; -a mbwembwe. high-spirited {adj} changamfu, -epesi, kunjufu; (a horse) -enye kwenda mbio. high spot {n} tukio muhimu. high street {n} barabara kuu/muhimu (katika mji). high table {n} meza kuu. high tea {n} mchanganyiko wa chai na chakula cha jioni. high-tension {adj} (electric) -enye volteji kubwa. high tide {n} maji kujaa, maji makuu. high toned {adj} -a juu (katika jamii au kisomo). high treason {n} uhaini. high up n(colloq) mtu mashuhuri; mtu wa cheo cha juu. high water {n} see hightide. high-water mark nalama yenye kuonyesha kikomo cha juu cha maji kujaa; (fig) upeo wa mafanikio. highway n; high road barabara kuu. high way Code {n} kanuni/sheria za barabara. high-way-man nharamia, mnyang'anyi {adv} juu (lit, fig) lipa bei kubwa. live high ishi kitajiri (kwa vinono na vinywaji kochokocho). fly high (fig) -wa na tamaa kubwa. hold one's head high jiamini, jiona. run high (the sea) kabiliwa na mkondo mkali na maji makuu; (the feelings) chacharika. search/look/hunt high and low (for sth) tafuta kila mahali. highly {adv} sana he spoke highly of her alimsifu sana. highness

it	(used to refer to group of words which follow infinitive phrases) it is easy to learn Kiswahili ni rahisi kujifunza Kiswahili; (construction with for) it was hard for her to live on beer brewing ilikuwa vigumu kwake kuishi kwa kupika pombe; (gerundial phrase) it is no use trying to win me back haitasaidia kujaribu kurudisha roho yangu; a clause: does it matter what you do next? ina tofauti yoyote kuwa utafanya nini baadaye?

it	(used as a formal or meaningless word to supply a subject) dealing with weather, atmospheric condition etc kuna it is hot kuna joto; (for time) ni it is 18th of January ni tarehe_18 ya Januari; (for distance) it is five kilometres to Kileleni ni kilometa tano hadi Kileleni; (vaguely for the general situation or for sth that is understood from context) you've had it utakiona.
it	(used to bring into prominence one part of a sentence) it was his second book which made him famous ni kitabu chake cha pili kilichomfanya mashuhuri (the object of a verb) it is the pocket dictionary that I want ni kamusi ya mfukoni niitakayo (the object of a prep) it was Jimmy I gave the book to ni Jimmy niliyempa kitabu (an adverbal adjunct) it was on Monday that I saw him ilikuwa Jumatatu nilipomwona its (poss) {adj} -ake the dog wagged it s tail mbwa alitikisa mkia wake. it self reflex pron -enyewe. by itself -enyewe the machine works by itself mashine inajiendesha yenyewe, peke yake.

fuata, heshimu keep up old customs endeleza/fuata mila za kale; endelea we will keep up the discussion the whole day tutaendelea kujadili mchana kutwa; tunza it costs me a great deal to keep up my farminanigharimu sana kulitunza shamba langu. keep it up endelea.

lay	(non-material things, and fig uses) weka. lay (one's) hands on sth/sby) nyang'anya; chukua he keeps everything he can lay his hands on huchukua kila kitu anachokiona; umiza, jeruhi; pata; (eccles) bariki. laying-on of hands uwekaji wakfu; kufanya kasisi; uthibitisho. lay the blame for sth on sby laumu, twisha/tupia lawama. lay a (heavy) burden on sby pa kazi/wajibu mzito; pa mateso. lay one's hopes on wekea matumaini. lay a strict injunction on sby (to do sth to) amuru. lay great/ little store by/on sth, thamini sana/kidogo. laystress/emphasis/ weight on sth fanya kuwa muhimu, sisitiza. lay a tax on sth toza kodi.

Tahadhari! look-out {n} keep a good look-out (for); be on the look-out (for) -wa mwangalifu, -wa macho; (mil) mahali pa kulindia, ulingo; mlinzi (sing only)(prospect) jambo la kutarajiwa, matarajio that's your own look out! shauri yako! look sth out for sby chagulia mtu kitu (baada ya kukichunguza). look over sth kagua, chunguza. look sth over kagua sehemu mojamoja. look-over {n} ukaguzi. look round (fig) angalia uwezekano (kabla ya kufanya jambo); geuza kichwa (kuangalia kila upande). look round (sth) tembelea/zungukia mahali, (ili kuangalia). look through sth durusu. look sth through kagua kitu kwa makini. look to sth chunga, angalia. look to sby for sth/to do sth tegemea mtu kwa jambo/ kwa ajili ya kufanya jambo. look to/towards elekea. look up angalia juu; tengemaa, ongezeka bei au ufanisi. look sth up tafuta kitu kitabuni nk look sby up tembelea mtu. look sby up and down kagua mtu; tazama (mtu) kwa dharau.

(with)/without so much as(na)/bila hata {adv} sana, mno it is too much (costly) ghali sana much too dear ghali sana/mno. much more zaidi sana. be too much for zidi nguvu, shinda, lemea. much to sby's surprise kwa mshangao.much more/less seuze; sembuse much as I hate it, I must... ingawa nachukia, sina budi I thought as much nilifikiri hivyo it is as much (as) saying ni kama kusema. as much bali kile kile; hivyo so much kubwa mno/ sana so much so that kwa kiasi kikubwa kwamba not so much X as Y y kuliko x. muchness {n} (only in colloq phrase) much of a muchness karibu sawasawa, hakuna tofauti.

on	{adv} part (to show progress, activity) come on fanyafanya; fanya haraka. work onendelea na kazi. and so on na kuendelea, na kadhalika. later on baadaye. on and on bila kukoma/kusita.
on	(to show places) kuwa juu ya; kuvaa your hat is not on straight hukuvaa sawa kofia. on to, prep juu ya.
on	(contrasted with off) the lights are on taa zinawaka; endelea kuwepo is water on? maji yangalipo?, maji yako?
on	(combined with be and have in various meanings) what's on? kuna nini? have you anything on tonight? unafanya chochote leo usiku? be on about sth (colloq) endelea kuzungumzia/kulalamika juu ya jambo. be on at sby (colloq) sumbua, kera, fuatafuata. be onto sby/sth wasiliana na; jua juu ya be on to a criminal wa na habari juu ya mhalifu. be on to a good thing shikilia jambo jema, fanikiwa.
on	kwa kuelekea. head oncollision {n} kugongana uso kwa uso.
on	{prep} juu ya, -ni put posters on the wall bandika mabango/picha ukutani suffer disaster on disaster pata makosi juu ya mkosi.
on	(indicating time) on Sunday Jumapili let's meet on 1st May Tukutane Mei Mosi onFridays kila Ijumaa on arrival nitakapofika. on time kwa wakati unaotakiwa/ ulioahidiwa.
on	(indicating direction) turn one's back on sby tojali mtu, pa kisogo.
on	(indicating charge) put tax on cigarettes wekea sigara kodi.
on	(indicatinga proximity) karibu na a town on the coast mji karibu ya pwani.
on	kuhusu, juu ya a lecture on publications mhadhara juu ya machapisho be keen on the law jihusisha mno na sheria.
on	(indicating membership) she is on the commission yeye ni mjumbe wa tume.
on	(expressing the basis/reason for sth) kwa a book based on facts kitabu tokana na matukio halisi.

time	(also) a + {adj} + time kipimo cha muda six hours is a period of time saa sita ni kipindi cha muda we have no time to lose hatuna muda wa kupoteza. behind time liochelewa the bus is two hours behind time basi limechelewa saa mbili. on time liowahi, katika/kwa wakati wake she came on time aliwahi. in no time mara moja, haraka sana. (from/since) time immemorial; (from/since) time out of mindzama za kale. gain time vuta muda (kwa mbinu). all the time kwa kipindi chote kile (kinachozungumziwa); wakati wote, muda wote. half the time nusu ya wakati uliotolewa; kwa muda mrefu; mara nyingi, karibuni wakati wote.

(work, etc) against time harakisha (kutokana na upungufu wa muda). at the same time kwa pamoja, kwa wakati mmoja, sawia; hata hivyo; pamoja na hayo, lakini he is poor at the same time he is generousni fukara hata hivyo ni mkarimu. at times; from time to time mara nyingi, mara kwa mara. at all timeswakati wote, mara zote. at your time of lifekatika umri wako. in time mapema she was in time for the lesson alifika mapema kwa somo; baada ya muda fulani, hatimaye you will succeed in time hatimaye utafanikiwa. near her time (a woman) karibia kujifungua. do time (coloq) tumikia kifungo. serve one's time -wa mwanagenzi kwa muda fulani; tumikia kifungo. his time is drawing near wakati wake unakaribia.

tone	{n} (sound) sauti; toni: namna ya tabia ya sauti in angry tones kwa sauti ya hasira. tone-deaf {adj} sioweza kutofautisha toni. tone-poem {n} muziki wa kuashiria wazo la kishairi au kisa fulani.
tone	(manner, style) tabia, hali, mwelekeo the tone of the school is good tabia ya shule ni nzuri.

tone	(color) kiwango cha rangi.

tooth	{n} jino; (incisor) jino la mbele; (molar) gego, chego. eye tooth {n} chonge. false tooth. jino bandia go to have a tooth out enda kung'oa jino. armed to the teeth -enye silaha nyingi; -enye ulinzi mkali. cast sth in a person's teeth karipia, gombeza mtu. escape by the skin of one's teeth ponea chupuchupu. fight tooth and nail pigana kufa na kupona. get one's teeth into sth fanya kazi kwa bidii. lie in one's teeth/throat danganya bila aibu. long in the tooth zee. show one's teeth tishia, ogofya. have a sweet tooth penda vyakula vitamu. in the teeth of dhidi ya/kwa kukabiliana na. toothache {n} maumivu ya jino. tooth-brush {n} mswaki. tooth paste/powder {n} dawa ya meno. tooth pick {n} kimbaka, kichokoa meno.

why	(rel {adv} ) sababu, (kwa nini) maana! I will tell you why nitakuambia sababu this is why ndiyo sababu/maana; {int} lo!; (expressing surprise) kumbe! why look at that!kumbe! ona sasa!; (expressing protest) nsababu, kisa, hoja. the whys and the wherefores kisa na mkasa.

with	{prep} (equivalent to constructions with have) -enye, na, -a, kwa. with child (woman) mjamzito. with young (an animal) mwenye mimba.
with	(to indicate what is used for filling, covering) na, kwa fill with sand jaza na/kwa mchanga.
with	(means or instrument) kwa, na write with a pen andika kwa kalamu.
with	(accompaniment or relationship) na, pamoja na discuss a problem with jadiliana tatizo na. in with-enye kushirikiana na.
with	(antagonistic, opposing) -ana na quarrel with gombana na compete with shindana na. fall out with gombana na.
with	(causal) kwa sababu ya, kwa tremble with fear tetemeka kwa (sababu ya) woga.
with	(manner) kwa handle with care shughulikia kwa uangalifu.
with	sawa na, pamoja; wakati mmoja na move with time enda na wakati.
with	(indicate care, charge or possession) -wa na had no money with himhakuwa na fedha.
with	(separation) -ana na break with achana na.
with	(in agreement or sympathy) -ana na I am with you naafikiana na wewe. be/ get with it (slang) enda na wakati.
with	licha ya with all our effort licha ya juhudi yetu yote.
withal	{adv} (arch) zaidi, tena, juu ya hayo, aidha.

write	{vt} {vi} andika.
write	write sth down andika; punguza bei/ thamani. write sby down as mtu. write in for sth omba kwa barua. write off (for sth) agiza kwa barua. write sth off tunga haraka haraka; futa, maliza. write off {n} kitu kisicho na thamani tena, kitu kilichokwisha. write sth outandika kwa kirefu. write sth up andika vizuri, kamilisha; tia thamani kubwa kuliko; elezea, sifia. write up {n} maandishi ya tukio.

write	(author) mwandishi wa vitabu, mtunzi. writing

wrong	{adj} -baya, -ovu; -a dhambi.
wrong	(mistaken) -enye (ma) kosa, si sawa, si sahihi. wrong side out nje/ndani. be caught on the wrong foot fumaniwa, shtukizwa, fumwa, kutwa bila kujitayarisha. get out of bed on the wrong sideamka vibaya; amka na hasira. get hold of the wrong end of the stick kosa kabisa kuelewa jambo fulani, kuwa na dhana tofauti ya jambo, elewa vingine. in the wrong box mahali pasipostahili/pasipofaa. on the wrong side of fifty etc zidi/vuka miaka hamsini nk wrongheaded {adj} -kaidi; -potovu. wrong headedly {adv} .

(at the end of a letter) wako. yourself (reflex pron) mwenyewe, -ji did you make it yourself?umeitengeneza mwenyewe? did you make it for yourself? umejitengenezea? come by yourselves njooni peke yenu.
